definition: lining/(fig.) substance (as opposed to outward appearance)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Yoshitaka Yuriko was probably the best talent in the show.
sentences.chinese: 吉高由里子可能是剧中表现最好的演员。

sentences.english: Removing her skirt, she then asked Gessen to do another picture on the back of her petticoat.
sentences.chinese: 说着她脱下衬裙，让月仙在里子那一面再画一幅。

sentences.english: He had on a coat lined with fur.
sentences.chinese: 他穿了一件皮毛里子的大衣。

sentences.english: Both the inside and the outside of the quilt are new.
sentences.chinese: 这条被子的里子和面子都是新的。

sentences.english: Some skirts are lined so that they keep their shape better.
sentences.chinese: 一些裙子衬上里子就可以使其形更好看。

sentences.english: Therefore, Satoko always more important than the face.
sentences.chinese: 所以，里子永远比面子更重要。

sentences.english: Kusuda actress in sub-branches encountered more bizarre rumors funny.
sentences.chinese: 女星楠田枝里子遭遇的谣言更加离奇搞笑。

definition: dignity/face (as in "losing face")/honorable/creditable/(of sb's appearance) presentable/respectable
see 愛面子|爱面子[ai4 mian4 zi5]
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: to go through hell for the sake of keeping up appearances (idiom)
pinyin: si3 yao4 mian4 zi5 huo2 shou4 zui4

definition: to allow sb to save face/to defer to
to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
to let air pass through/to ventilate
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
